issue.title: Title Bar custom background & foreground colors not properly working
issue.body:
### Which version of the app?

WinUI 3 Gallery

### Description

- When switching the background color of the title bar, it doesn't evenly fill up the entire title bar and gets cut off at the title bar logo
- The foreground color controls do not work at all and have no functionality with the new top-level UI Element
- Resetting to the system title bar causes the window minimize, restore/maximize, and close button controls to become impossible to see

A video and screenshot have been attached showing the following issues.

### Screenshots

![SystemTitleBar_Issue_9-9-23](https://github.com/microsoft/WinUI-Gallery/assets/54720001/ea208ea8-9865-4f72-9856-2f51bc964324)

https://github.com/microsoft/WinUI-Gallery/assets/54720001/a6a4a250-95db-42c4-8183-eb4f903fd8b9



### Windows version

Insider Build (xxxxx)

### Additional context

These issues were tested and found on 23H2 (22631.2271) in the video, but I also found them on my laptop running 22H2 release. These issues were found in WinUI3 gallery version 2.2.0.0

comment.body: I don't really think so given that #1368 fixes the issues in this issue.

issue.title: WinUI 3 Gallery crash
issue.body:
### Which version of the app?

WinUI 3 Gallery

### Description

Hi,

I have played around with WinUI 3 Gallery and sometimes got crash. I can provide one scenario getting crash.

Step 1: Open WinUI 3 Gallery

Step 2: Click on NavigationView (inside Navigtation tab)

Step 3: Click on ParallaxView (inside Motion tab)

Step 4: Click back NavigationView => crash

Thanks.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Windows version

Windows 11 22H2 (22621)

### Additional context

_No response_

issue.title: Clicking NavigationView from search results crashes the app

labels.name: external-bug
labels.description: This bug requires a fix outside of the Gallery

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Searching for 'navigation' and clicking the NavigationView result will crash the app

**Steps to reproduce the bug**

1. Enter 'navigation' in the search box
2. Click on the search icon
3. NavigationView will appear in the search results
4. Click on NavigationView

**Expected behavior**
Opening the NavigationView page

**Actual behavior**
Crash

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4835617/170671005-5ef5fec7-ac2e-48c0-b59c-a1a2890c7bf5.png)

**Version Info**
<!-- Please enter the Gallery version, OS version(s), and form factor(s) -->

Gallery version (found on Settings page): 
- Version: 1.3.12.0

Windows 11 version: 
- Windows 11

Device form factor:
- Desktop

issue.title: Accessibility: Make a version of the WinUI Gallery that meets Accessibility requirements.
issue.body:
### Issue type

enhancement

### Which version of the app?

WinUI 3 Gallery

### Description

The current version of the WinUI Gallery doesn't meet Accessibility requirements. Most enterprises will require applications to comply with the accessibility requirements stated here: [https://www.w3.org/WAI/](https://www.w3.org/WAI/)

It would be great to have either an option or a version of the app that meets these requirements, and shows how WinUI applications could meet these requirements.

This applies to borders (Luminosity ratio) , visual focus indicators (only at the bottom), and many more....

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Windows version

Windows 11 22H2 (22621)

### Additional context

Our applications have to meet these requirements.

comment.body: We are working on it and addressing specific issues. It is our intent to keep working towards this goal. As @chingucoding mentioned, we have recently implemented Axe scans on every page, and other fixes are underway.

issue.title: Title Bar can't work as normal
issue.body:
### Which version of the app?

WinUI 3 Gallery

### Description

- The foreground color controls do not work, I think because use new `ExtendsContentIntoTitleBar = true;`
- I don't think the background color meets the definition of color in the Winows application. I even think that the application of system setup in win11 23h2 is a kind of error. The background color of the button hovered in the title bar in dark mode should be light gray (close to white), not dark gray (close to black).

> https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/apps/design/style/color

- The buttons in the title bar do not have the same fade-in and fade-out effect as the WinUI app created by C++/WinRT when entering and leaving.
- The titile bar foreground color can't change when I change app theme, when theme change  to dark from light, but tiltle foreground color still is white. When I was developing with Template Studio, I could change the foreground color of the title bar control when a theme change was detected. `App.MainWindow.AppWindow.TitleBar.ForegroundColor `

### Screenshots

![image](https://github.com/microsoft/WinUI-Gallery/assets/59414880/453b2975-22a6-4dbc-aadb-5a7192118dbf)
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/WinUI-Gallery/assets/59414880/77ddab1f-5284-4397-b6c9-9fc901393140)


### Windows version

Windows 11 22H2 (22621)

### Additional context

These issues were found in WinUI 3 Gallery version 2.2.0.0.

issue.title: Add feature to add "need triage" tag to new issues.
StorageApplicationPermissions throws exception in unpackaged app build
issue.body:
### Which version of the app?

WinUI 3 Gallery

### Description

In the `FilePickerPage.cs` there is the `async void PickFolderButton_Click(object sender, RoutedEventArgs e)` method:

[Line 187]
StorageApplicationPermissions.FutureAccessList.AddOrReplace("PickedFolderToken", folder);

If compiling as an unpackage application, this line throws an `ArgumentException` (see screenshot).

### Screenshots

![image](https://github.com/microsoft/WinUI-Gallery/assets/81915293/7e5ef068-1cc5-4d19-9887-15f4ee8a9a50)


### Windows version

Windows 10 22H2 (19045)

### Additional context

_No response_

comment.body: This is likely an API that doesn't work on unpackaged, and should be providing appropriate documentation.

issue.title: [Suggestion] Add link to _themeresources.xaml for each control

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Expand an existing sample or add feature to app

issue.body:
### Issue type

enhancement

### Which version of the app?

WinUI 3 Gallery

### Description

I often want to look at the default _themresources.xaml (the default style) for XAML controls ([example](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/4873563b7953e2431caed4efcdc3b8261d1405cd/dev/CommonStyles/TextBlock_themeresources.xaml#L38)):

* To see what [lightweight styling](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/apps/design/style/xaml-styles#lightweight-styling) brushes are available & see what their default values are
* To see what visual states there are
* To understand how a control is implemented (what parts does XAML use?)

Can we add links to these files for each control? Right now, it is difficult to find those implementations.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Windows version

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

comment.body: @bpulliam Noting here to investigate in proper linking to winui3 source.

commits.message: Fix a bug where incorrect foreground was used for Text on Accent tile
Fix Toolkit namespace
disable ReadyToRun as it was mistakenly trimming Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollView from Microsoft.WinUI.dll

Merge pull request #1352 from microsoft/scottj1s/disable_r2r

disable ReadyToRun as it was mistakenly trimming Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollView from Microsoft.WinUI.dll
WinUI Gallery 2.2.0.0 Release (#1353)
Add DesktopAcrylic Kind (Base, Thin)
Update SystemBackdropsSample
Add Missing Sample for Desktop Acrylic
fix indent

Merge pull request #1354 from ghost1372/AcrylicKind

Add new Desktop Acrylic kind (Base and Thin)

Added a "Capture element / camera preview" page in the Media section. (#1357)

## Description
`CaptureElement` from UWP XAML does not exist in WinAppSDK, but
`MediaPlayerElement` can be used in its place. The change adds a new
sample page to demonstrate how this can be done.

Note: Currently this page just reuses the same icon as the
MediaPlayerElement page. Ideally at some point we'll get a camera icon
which could be used here instead.

## Motivation and Context
Demonstrate the couple of calls to get from a `MediaCapture` to an
`IMediaPlaybackSource` necessary to display the capture in a
MediaPlayerElement. This also demonstrates basic creation of a
`MediaCapture` to provide an end-to-end sample. This sample should help
address questions in microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml#4710 and
microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml#8214.

## How Has This Been Tested?
Ad-hoc testing and testing with Accessibility Insights for Windows tool.

## Types of changes
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing
functionality to change)
Update to WinAppSDK 1.4.1 and remove menu theme workaround (#1359)
Fixes for WinUI submodule compatibility (#1362)

Fix division by zero (#1366)

<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
Fix division by zero exception when the window is too narrow.

## Motivation and Context
Fixes #1365 

## Types of changes
<!--- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all
the boxes that apply: -->
- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing
functionality to change)

First round of UWP link replacement (#1347)

Co-authored-by: Bob Pulliam <bpulliam@microsoft.com>
Switch .NET 7 (#1115)
Fix issue that crashes the app when navigating to SemanticZoomPage (#1363)

Clickable Interactive control sample for custom titlebar (#1360)

With 1.4 changes, WinUI 3 custom titlebar now uses appwindow titlebar + nonclientinputpointersource apis under the hood. This opens up new possibilities like allowing clickable interactive controls like textbox, button in the titlebar area, surrounded by draggable region on both left and the right sides.

This code adds a sample to titlebar page which shows users how to create interactive controls in winui 3 titlebar. It also demonstrates the power of mixing and matching high level winui 3 custom titlebar apis and low level nonclient apis.

Set TrimMode explicitly back to partial for .NET 7 compat (#1378)

See:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/deploying/trimming/trimming-options?pivots=dotnet-7-0
Update to WinAppSDK 1.4.2 and remove temporary workaround for including version info without dupe warnings (#1379)
Cleanup unnecessary code (#1299)

Add Test to Scan All Pages for Axe Issues (#1361)

<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
<!--- Describe your changes in detail -->
- Add a test that physically navigates to each page via NavView and
check for Axe issues.
- Utilizes DynamicData attribute to create grouped tests based on
section category (ie. TreeView parent)
- This also tests for run-time crashes with each page. 
- Miscellaneous Axe fixes.

## Types of changes
<!--- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all
the boxes that apply: -->
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing
functionality to change)

Update WinUIGallery/ControlPages/DesignGuidance/TypographyPage.xaml

Co-authored-by: Jay <65828559+Jay-o-Way@users.noreply.github.com>

issue.title: WinUI 3 doesn't render correctly on a legacy PC system with Windows Pro 10 64-bit 22H2
issue.body:
### Which version of the app?

WinUI 3 Gallery

### Description

I would like to report a problem with WinUI 3 applications on an older PC system that runs Windows 10 Pro 64-bit 22H2. The system specifications are as follows:

[DxDiag.txt](https://github.com/microsoft/WinUI-Gallery/files/13113027/DxDiag.txt)

The system has 4GB of RAM and uses Intel GMA 3000 for graphics, which only supports up to Directx 9.0c.

The problem occurs when I use the PowerToys app, which has recently adopted the WinUI 3 framework. I demonstrate the behavior of WinUI 2 and WinUI 3 Gallery demo apps in the issue below.

https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/issues/29340

Each WinUI 3 app does not render correctly, and it shows a blank window and a blank title. I suspect this is due to the lack of support for Directx 11 or higher by the Intel GMA 3000 or 4 GB system RAM sharing video memory with the integrated graphics card.

I suspect the same issue with the custom color picker for Window 10's Settings > Colors > Custom Color.

![Screenshot 2023-10-24 173544](https://github.com/microsoft/WinUI-Gallery/assets/1452656/099437c0-a6b0-4218-b5ee-56643b3570fd)


I hope this issue can be resolved or at least acknowledged by the developers. Thank you for your attention and assistance.


### Screenshots

_No response_

### Windows version

Windows 10 22H2 (19045)

### Additional context

_No response_

comment.body:
By using Microsoft OpenJDK-21.0.0.35, I created a Java Swing-based drawing application from [this project](https://github.com/haxxorsid/swing-paint-application/tree/master). With JColorChooser, I was able to produce the HSV color box without encountering the blank box issue that I found with the WinUI color picker component on my legacy PC system.

![Screenshot 2023-10-26 231119](https://github.com/microsoft/WinUI-Gallery/assets/1452656/a3e9f42f-5ab0-44e0-aaf4-635fc0028b4e)
